intro: Mickelia hemiotis, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in coastal and sandy soils, often growing near the sea. Its night-blooming habit makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
